'speaker_2': 'Thank you so much. President Mosquito. Last November, the Seattle Renters Commission recommended that council take up this urgent issue. In 2018, the Seattle Women's Commission and the King County Bar Association jointly issued a study Losing Home the Human Cost of Eviction in Seattle.'

'speaker_2': 'The study found that nearly 90% of people evicted become homeless, and that people of color were disproportionately, in fact, overwhelmingly were the ones who were evicted. 'speaker_2': 'So it's specifically affecting the most marginalized in our society. Most Seattle tenants are evicted for not paying their rent in, you know, for being short on rent. And in most cases, the study found the evicted tenants owed one month or less in rent.'

'speaker_2': 'You can't make the step up. Eviction also can be a death sentence. The study reviewed 2017 evictions and found that six Seattle tenants died during or right after evictions. 'speaker_2': 'The study also found that at least nine people who died homeless on the street in 2017 had an eviction filed against them in the three preceding years. 'speaker_4': 'The municipal code requires the City Council to hold a public hearing in advance of the commencement of negotiations with the Police Officers Guild and requires the city to consider in good faith whether and how to carry forward the interests expressed at the public hearing.'

'speaker_4': 'This does not exist for any other bargaining unit in the city, nor for any other any other contract requirement in in the city.
